ngiemboon: Yěsô la kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ, ńtúm ntse ḿbiŋ né tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ yɔ́b.
en: So he got into a boat, crossed over, and came to his own town.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔgɔ ngàŋa kwʉ́ʼte ńtó, á nuŋe na páŋte. Yěsô gyá ntí gie mbàŋa ŋwɛ́ lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m na yé, ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́ʼte ngie: «Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, ɔɔ shÿó mbòŋo! Mé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwó gù.»
en: Just then   some men  # 9:2 Lit then they brought to him a paralytic lying on a stretcher. Seeing their faith, Jesus told the paralytic, “Have courage, son, your sins are forgiven.”   # 9:2 Mt 4:24; 8:10,13; 9:22; Lk 7:48; Jn 16:33

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê leen ńké ńzye lékwaŋa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pɔ́b ngie: «Nyìŋ wɔ̀ɔn zoonté Ssé!»
en: At this, some of the scribes said to themselves, “He’s blaspheming! ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé mmó gie pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi gǎa ńgẅiin yɛ̂ ntí nkwaŋá tepòŋ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi?
en: Perceiving their thoughts,   Jesus said, “Why are you thinking evil things in your hearts?   # 9:4 Or minds

ngiemboon: Pi gyǎ gí ngie á zeŋe pɔ́ légɔɔn né nyìŋ ngie: “Mé legé menò tepòŋ mú,” kà pɔ́ légɔɔn ngie “lu ssé ńgiŋ?”
en: For which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi ké ńzsé ngie Míŋ Nyìŋ aa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ńgẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b.» Yěsô gɔɔn púʼu, ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́ʼte ngie: «Lu ssé, ńkaa páŋte gù, ńdɔg ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a gù.»
en: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”  #— #then he told the paralytic, “Get up, take your stretcher, and go home.”

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ lu ssé, ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: So he got up and went home.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ gyá yɔɔn nò, ḿbú ḿbɔ́g tɛʼ, ńguʼte Ssé na páʼ à nǎ yɔɔn ntí metʉ̀ mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: When the crowds saw this, they were awestruck  ,# 9:8 Lit afraid and gave glory  # 9:8 Mt 5:16; 15:31; Lk 7:16; 13:13; Jn 15:8; Ac 4:21 to God, who had given such authority to men.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉʼó ńgʉa, ńgwaa cʉa jʉʼ gie mé kẅé ncùb pà Loma wó, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ néŋe, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Matîo. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, pɔ̀gɔ zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńgiŋe!» Matîo lu ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: As Jesus went on from there,   he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, “Follow me,” and he got up and followed him.  # 9:9 Mt 10:3; Mk 2:14; 3:18; Lk 6:15; Ac 1:13

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ ndá Matîo ńne ńjÿó mmó, petsɔ́ pakẅé ncùb pà Loma tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, lâ tsɔ́ ngàŋa tsẅé tepòŋ, tó ńkẅɛ́te Yěsô pâ ngàŋakwò yé, pâ pɔ́ néŋe ssé, ńne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó.
en: While he was reclining at the table in the house, many tax collectors and sinners came to eat with Jesus and his disciples.

ngiemboon: Pafalísáyè gyá púʼu, ńzɛ́te ngàŋakwò Yěsô ngie: «Mélàʼakɔ́ tá gẅi pâ pakẅé ncùb pà Loma lâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ teme shúm ḿpfɛ́ɛ?»
en: When the Pharisees saw this, they asked his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô júʼ, ésaga mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le gwɔ́ ntentʉ́, ńgʉa éfaʼa ngÿò meffo wɔ́, nyìŋ guɔ tá faʼa yé.
en: Now when he heard this, he said, “It is not those who are well who need a doctor, but those who are sick.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa ńzíʼi mmó gie yɔɔn nò gie mé la ŋweʼe lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn: “N kwoŋo tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe, ńcʉa shúm pwɔʼ.” Mélàʼmie Mèŋ n ka te tó pɔ́ létóŋ pʉ̀a pie é kwaŋ ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a membòŋo ngie pɔ́ piŋe mbwó Ssé wɔ́. Mèŋ n ka tǒ ńtí pɔ́ megàŋ mefʉa.»
en: Go and learn what this means: I desire mercy and not sacrifice.   ,# 9:13 Hs 6:6; Mc 6:6–8; Mt 12:7 For I didn’t come to call the righteous, but sinners.”   # 9:13 Other mss add to repentance

ngiemboon: Megàŋa kwò Jÿâŋ gÿo ńtó, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: «Peg lâ pà Falísaye neŋé ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ejú ngàŋakwò piŋ té yɔ́b púʼu gÿo mélàʼakɔ́?»
en: Then John’s disciples came to him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gʉa leluŋó na nò lɔ́ɔnndá, ndúm nzwěngʉ̀ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ssé, meshǔ pé néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lemÿɔ̀g lá? Táʼ mé ge láʼ fó mbwó pɔ́b tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ésaʼa yé, pɔ́ leen ńké ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè fʉʼó.
en: Jesus said to them, “Can the wedding guests    be sad while the groom is with them? The time   # 9:15 Lit days will come when the groom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le lɔgɔ mmó nzsǒ sẅé ńtsɛ́ lepÿé na nzẅìŋe nzsǒ wɔ́. Nyìŋ gÿo púʼu, mbà mmó nzsǒ sẅé ge kẅiʼi shʉa nzsǒ, lepÿé pú fáŋ.
en: No one patches an old garment with unshrunk cloth, because the patch pulls away from the garment and makes the tear worse.

ngiemboon: Mé té néŋ melùʼ mie mé nyé ńtsɔ́ʼɔ á tsɛ̀ɛ nzẅìŋe ntúʼ ngùb wɔ́. Mé lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, mbà melùʼ mesẅé ge fuʼ, éshʉ́a nzẅìŋe ntúʼ ŋwɛ́, mé sɔ́ɔn melùʼ, ésɔ́ɔn ntúʼ. Á zɛ́te ngie mé néŋ melùʼ mesẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntúʼ yesẅé, melùʼ pɔ́ ntúʼ pú ńtsẅɛ́.»
en: And no one puts    new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the skins burst, the wine spills out, and the skins are ruined. No, they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn nò mbwó pɔ́b púʼu, atsɔ̌ ndÿò tó, ńnuŋe mekwò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn wemanzwě lěen ńkwé pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, táʼ, tóo ńzába pwó jú na yé, à gwɔ́ wó.»
en: As he was telling them these things,   suddenly one of the leaders came and knelt down before him, saying, “My daughter just died,  # 9:18 Lit daughter has now come to the end but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”  # 9:18 Mt 8:2–3; Mk 5:23

ngiemboon: Yěsô lu ssé, pâ ngàŋakwò yé cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: So Jesus and his disciples got up and followed   him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńgee, atsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ nùɔ láʼ, ńgẅiin guɔ máshúɔ, mbà á gegé yé gege ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém. Á náʼte, éfó nzèm, ńtó ńkíbe tsɔ̌ɔn nzsǒ Yěsô,
en: Just then, a woman who had suffered from bleeding for twelve years approached from behind and touched the end of his robe,

ngiemboon: mélàʼmie à la ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «N dɔɔn ńkíbe pɔ́ ndàʼ nzsǒ Yěsô, mbà n ge zeŋe!»
en: for she said to herself, “If I can just touch his robe, I’ll be made well.”  ,# 9:21 Mt 14:36; Mk 3:10; Lk 6:19

ngiemboon: Yěsô sele nnɛ́, ńgyá yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, ɔɔ shÿó mbòŋo, agù lezǎb ntʉ́m na mèŋ gÿǒ ɔ̀ tsẅɛ́. Á gwóon ńzeŋe pɔ́ fʉʼó fʉʼó.»
en: Jesus turned and saw her. “Have courage, daughter,” he said. “Your faith has saved you.”   ,# 9:22 Mt 15:28; Mk 10:52; Lk 7:50; 17:19; 18:42 And the woman was made well from that moment.  # 9:22 Lit hour

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu mbʉ̀a ndÿò wa, ńgyá, mbà papúʼ shúm ńdɔg ńtúŋo mpfó ně ndáʼ ńtó tà ńtyéte, aláʼ piŋ ne ńzẅɛɛ shwǒŋ.
en: When Jesus came to the leader’s house, he saw the flute players and a crowd lamenting loudly.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi gʉate, múɔ manzwě kaa kwé, à lyé lyě.» Aláʼ júʼ ńgẅe yé gẅe.
en: “Leave,” he said, “because the girl is not dead but asleep.”    And they laughed at him.

ngiemboon: Mé fó ndá ńkẅile pʉ̀a. Yěsô kúu ndá, ńkíbe pwó múɔ manzwě, á gwóon ńdu ssé.
en: After the crowd had been put outside, he went in and took her by the hand, and the girl got up.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ yɔɔn nò ḿbú sa jʉʼ na yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ.
en: Then news of this spread throughout that whole area.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉʼó ne ńgee, etsɔ́ pafʉ̀menÿɔ́g mépʉ́a cʉ́me nzèm yé, ńne ńgaʼte, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Míŋ fùɔ Ndavîd, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe még.»
en: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, calling out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David! ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu ndá, pafʉ̀menÿɔ́g pa tó, ńkẅɛ́te yé. Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi kwǎŋ ngie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n gÿo mmó gie pi zɛ́te lɛ̂?» Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Oon me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ɔ̀ kuʼu légÿo.»
en: When he entered the house, the blind men approached him, and Jesus said to them, “Do you believe    that I can do this? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńzába pwó na menÿɔ́g mɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Á poŋ ngie akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ à gwɔ́ páʼ pi zǎb ntʉ́m na mèŋ ńkwaŋ ngie á ge gwɔ́.»
en: Then he touched their eyes, saying, “Let it be done for you according to your faith.”

ngiemboon: Menÿɔ́g mɔ́b leen ńgyá jʉʼ. Yěsô tɔʼɔ wɔ́b ngie: «Ḿbɔ́ɔn gẅí léké ńgÿo tà nyìŋ zsé páʼ á cʉ̌a púʼu.»
en: And their eyes were opened. Then Jesus warned them sternly, “Be sure that no one finds out.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pɔ́ zyɛ́ʼ tà ńkúu pǐ, ńdɔg lezíŋ Yěsô, ḿbú sa jʉʼ tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ pàga láʼ.
en: But they went out and spread the news about him throughout that whole area.

ngiemboon: Pafʉ̀menÿɔ́g gwaa fó ndá kẅɛ, mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńtóo mvfò Yěsô, mbà tsɔ́ ssé tepòŋ la gÿo, á cʉ́ʼʉ mbùʼncwò.
en: Just as they were going out, a demon-possessed man who was unable to speak was brought to him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tà ńjwoŋ yɛ̌ ssé tepòŋ, à mbùʼncwò gwóon ńzye légɔɔn nò. Aláʼ gyá ḿbú ḿmɔɔn, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mé laa zɔɔn ńgyá yɛ̂ ntí nò á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ wɔ́.»
en: When the demon had been driven out, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were amazed, saying, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel! ”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pafalísáyè ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tándá messé tepòŋ zɔ gÿo tá Yěsô kuʼu léjwoŋ messé tepòŋ!»
en: But the Pharisees said, “He drives out demons by the ruler of the demons.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô la ne ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ntsèm mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ meláʼ, ńkúu nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, ńgee ndá cúʼtè ńzíʼi pʉ̀a nò Ssé, ésáʼa nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie éshwoŋo páʼ lefùɔ Ssé ée púʼu, ńgÿo meguɔ ntí ntí maga na pʉ̀a, melɔ̌ʼ ntí ntí maga mbùm pʉ̀a,
en: Jesus continued going around to all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom,   and healing every  # 9:35 Or every kind of disease and every sickness.  # 9:35 Other mss add among the people,# 9:35 Or physical ailment

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá menùɔ láʼ mezìŋe mɔ́b kúu yé, mélàʼmie á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ pǔ ńkʉ́a tà ńtsáŋ páʼ nùɔ menjʉ̀njÿò gie à mpfèle te wó wɔ́ la.
en: When he saw the crowds, he felt compassion for them, because they were distressed and dejected,   like sheep without a shepherd.  # 9:36 Nm 27:17; 1Kg 22:17; Ezk 34:5; Zch 10:2

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó ngàŋakwò yé ngie: «Eshúm sie mé gee nkáʼ ńdaga, é gyɔ́ɔn tɛʼ, ngàŋafàʼ piŋ te gyɔ́ɔn.
en: Then he said to his disciples,   “The harvest is abundant, but the workers are few.

ngiemboon: Pi sẅíŋte ngàŋ nkáʼ, à kẅiʼi megàŋafàʼ pie é ge ne laga shúm sé.»
en: Therefore, pray to the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.”
